intro: Nauclea surinamensis, commonly known as Surinam nauclea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Nauclea surinamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
